item.title: Marvel Rivals Officially Reveals New Battle Pass for Season 1, Darkhold
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/marvel-rivals-officially-reveals-new-battle-pass-for-season-1-darkhold/

Marvel Rivals has released the official trailer for their Season 1 Battle Pass, Darkhold; here’s all you need to know.

Marvel Rivals Season 1: Eternal Night Fall is all set to release tomorrow, January 10, 2025, and ahead of that, the developers have provided players with a glimpse of this season’s battle pass. The new battle pass, Darkhold, will consist of double the Season 0’s pass content featuring 10 new skins along with other related cosmetics. The list of characters receiving new costumes in the Darkhold battle pass can be found below: 

  • Loki – All Butcher
  • Wolverine – Blood Berserker 
  • Rocket – Bounty Hunter 
  • Magneto – King Magnus 
  • Iron Man – Blood Edge Armor
  • Adam Warlock – Blood Soul
  • Scarlet Witch – Emporium Matron
  • Peni Parker – Blue Tarantula 
  • Namor – Savage Sub-Mariner
  • Moon Knight – Blood Moon Knight 

Players already knew about the skins arriving with this battle pass as RivalsAssembled on X (formerly Twitter) leaked all of the Marvel Rivals Darkhold Cosmetics for Season 1 early. 

Here’s the official description for the Darkhold battle pass:

The Darkhold contains two powerful spells that have aroused interest in opposing forces: The Vampiric Verses can create creatures of the night, while the Montesi Formula can eliminate them. When Eternal Night descended upon New York, the Darkhold’s pages were scattered across Manhattan. Now, the race is on to prevent its dark power from falling into the wrong hands. Join us in the battle in Marvel Rivals and help recover the lost pages!

In other news, check out all the new content for Marvel Rivals Season 1: Eternal Night Falls here. Also, check out all the buffs and nerfs each hero is receiving at the start of the new season. What are your thoughts on Marvel Rivals’ battle pass for season 1? Let us know in the comments or our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Assassin’s Creed Shadows being delayed to March 2025. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.  

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

Ubisoft Appoints Advisors to Explore All Company Options

Ubisoft has announced that it has appointed “leading advisors” to explore all options for the company moving forward.

Breaking: Assassin’s Creed Shadows Delayed To March

Assassin’s Creed Shadows has been delayed yet again, this time from its February 14 date to a new date in March 2025.

Game of Thrones: Kingsroad Is Heading To PC After All

A closed beta was announced for Game of Thrones: Kingsroad, and with it came the confirmation of the game’s release for PC.

item.title: What is CS2 Skin Wear Rating? (Explained)
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/what-is-cs2-skin-wear-rating-explained/

A CS2 skin wear rating is a crucial component in determining the value of the skin itself. Counter-Strike’s massive skin economy is made up of hundreds of thousands of skins. The wear rating of a skin can determine whether a skin is worth tens, hundreds, or even thousands of dollars.

Let’s take a deep dive into what CS2 skin wear rating is, what determines it, and how it affects a skin’s price.

Before you jump below, consider trying your luck on Clash.gg – you could turn your unwanted skins into something much more valuable (18+ only)

What is CS2 Skin Wear Rating?

A wear rating is a numerical value, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0, that determines the amount of wear on a specific CS2 skin. The higher the wear rating, the more used and rugged it appears. The lower the wear rating, the more new and clean it appears. Wear rating is also commonly referred to as float value.

The wear rating directly determines what a skin’s exterior classification is:

  • Skins with a wear rating of 0.00 to 0.07 are considered Factory New.
  • Skins with a wear rating of 0.07 to 0.15 are considered Minimal Wear.
  • Skins with a wear rating of 0.15 to 0.38 are considered Field-Tested.
  • Skins with a wear rating of 0.38 to 0.45 are considered Well Worn.
  • Skins with a wear rating of 0.45 to 1.00 are considered Battle-Scarred.

For virtually all skins, items that are Factory New buy and sell for much higher than any of the other exteriors. Then it’s usually a sharp drop to Minimal Wear prices, and then another sharp drop to the higher wear exterior prices. Skins that are closer to the 0.00 rating will sell for much more, even more than other Factory New skins. If you’re looking at Factory New skin listings on the marketplace, the cheapest ones are the ones closest to the 0.07 threshold.

What Determines CS2 Skin Wear Rating?

A CS2 skin’s wear rating is determined when it is opened from a case. Skins are not guaranteed to be Factory New or Minimal Wear when opened from a case. It’s also a common misconception that CS2 skins degrade over time with use. Wear rating does not increase over time with use.

Many skins can only be opened within a specific exterior classification. Doppler knives, among the most expensive CS2 skins, can only be opened as Factory New or as Minimal Wear, for example.

What CS2 skin in your inventory has the lowest wear rating? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

If you want to unlock free daily cases and rewards in CS2, check out Clash.gg (18+ only)

Stay tuned to Insider Gaming for the latest esports news. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
